lesson.name: 5B - EI Lesson Plan – Part 2: Explain and Model for Content Learning

page.title: EI for Content Learning - Preparing for the Explain and Model Step
page.contents:
In EI for content learning, the teacher prepares for the explanation and modeling steps by:

  • Identifying key concepts and/or vocabulary (declarative knowledge) that are critical for student understanding.
  • Choosing a tool to organize the information in a way that will be most beneficial to student comprehension and retention.

Once the graphic organizer is selected, the instructor must:
  • Plan the lesson introduction (set up new learning).*
  • Develop blank and completed graphic organizer examples.
  • Consider effective nonexamples to use during explanation.
  • Plan how to explain content using the graphic organizer.
  • Plan how to model use of the graphic organizer to explore content.

To guide us through these steps, let’s examine an example of how a graphic organizer was used to teach basic paragraph structure.

Click Next below to continue.

page.title: Explain (I DO) for Content Learning (video activity)
page.contents:
The Explain part of an explicit instruction is based on the teacher introducing learners to how the GO organizes the content.

During the explanation:

  • Learners should have a filled in GO to examine.
  • The teacher should explain the parts of the GO using learner friendly language.

Again, we call this step I DO because the teacher is doing most of the talking.

Let’s watch a teacher explain the parts of a paragraph using a GO shaped like a hamburger sandwich. The GO helps her English language learners understand the parts of a paragraph using the structure of a hamburger sandwich. She is developing their content knowledge of paragraph structure.

Click on the link below to view of copy of the hamburger GO.

Hamburger Writing graphic organizer - filled in (pdf format)



Play the video below to watch a clip from Observing Standards-in-Action: ESL Classroom Lesson. As you watch, make note of how the teacher explains the hamburger GO and observe for the following.

  • Her use of examples and nonexamples
  • How consistently she uses the GO to explain the parts of a paragraph
  • The questions she asks to check for learners’ comprehension.


Video - SIA: Writing a Paragraph Explanation (ESL)

SIA: Writing a Paragraph Explanation (ESL)

Video Transcript

page.title: EI for Content Learning: Explain & Model – Wrap Up & Assignments
page.contents:
During this session, we’ve examined how EI for content learning differs from EI for skill and strategy learning. In particular, how to use graphic organizers during the explain and model phases of the lesson to provide a clear structure for learners when learning new content. Now it’s your turn to apply explicit instruction to content teaching.  

Consider the graphic organizers you reviewed earlier in this session, as well as the content (declarative knowledge) you typically teach. What is one graphic organizer/content combination that you feel would provide a clear structure for student learning? How would you explain and model the use of this graphic organizer?  

You may wish to refer to these reflections in completing the Session 5 Assignment A.

Week 5 Assignments overview:

A. In the 1st assignment for this session we ask you to apply what you have learned to creating another EI lesson – this one for content learning. You will be asked to draft the lesson introduction, explanation and modeling phases, and to submit your lesson for facilitator feedback.

B. In the 2nd assignment for this session, we ask you to review and incorporate facilitator feedback on your completed EI lesson for skill and strategy learning, and then share this revised lesson with your peers for feedback.  You are also asked to provide feedback on at least 2 others’ EI lesson plan ideas.

You may complete these two assignments in any order.

Click Finish Lesson to end this lesson, return to the Main Course Menu, and access the Session #4 Assignment.

page.title: Modeling (I DO) for Content learning (activity)
page.contents:
The next part of the explicit instruction lesson for content learning is the teacher demonstration or modeling showing how to use the graphic organizer. This is a continuation of I DO. The teacher is still doing most of the talking.

(1) Click on the link below to read an example of a teacher modeling how to use the hamburger graphic organizer.
Model – Hamburger Writing EI Lesson


(2) Then print out (or save) the lesson plan and identify the following modeling behaviors.
  • Places where the teacher would be physically pointing to different parts of the graphic organizer. [Put a star* next to these places.]
  • Statements where the teacher is showing her thinking (think-alouds). [Underline these statements.]

Click on the Next button below to continue.

page.title: Video Activity – Explain for Content Learning Possible Responses
page.contents:
While many answers are possible, below are our responses to the questions regarding the SIA: Writing a Paragraph Explanation video clip:

The teacher explains the hamburger graphic organizer by:

  • Using examples and nonexamples
    The teacher shows pictures of cookies, spaghetti, fruit and bacon as non-examples of what goes into a hamburger. (This is to make the point that the inside of a paragraph has to support the main idea: the information has to belong.)
  • Consistently using the graphic organizer to explain the parts of a paragraph
    • She has a picture on chart paper and she labels each part of the picture as she describes the graphic organizer
    • Students have the hamburger graphic organizer at their seats to refer to while they listen.
  • Using questions to check for learners’ comprehension. Examples of her questions are:
    • What is a topic?
    • What happens if we take off the bottom?
    • What does it mean to support things?
    • What is the bottom called?

 

Click Next below to continue.

page.title: Modeling (I DO) for Content learning – possible responses
page.contents:
While your answers may vary, click on the link below to see our responses to the activity.

Model – Hamburger Writing EI Lesson – responses

How did your answers compare?  
Thinking of the graphic organizers you found on the web, can you visualize how you might demonstrate using them to your learners?

For your reference, linked below are copies of a blank Hamburger Graphic Organizer page and the Hamburger Writing Lesson - Introduction, Explain and Model sections.

  • Hamburger Graphic Organizer – blank (pdf format)
  • Hamburger Writing EI Lesson Plan Parts 1 &2
